key_points: Taxpayers who did not receive their first or second stimulus payments need to file a tax return to get the money.
The IRS opened up Free File on Friday for taxpayers to claim a credit for their stimulus payment.
IRS Free File is available to taxpayers or families that earned $72,000 or less in 2020.
Free File offers nine products in English and two in Spanish.
More than 4 million people used the free products last year.
IRS Free File providers will hold completed tax returns until the IRS begins processing returns on Feb. 12.
Eligibility for IRS Free File products varies based on age, income, and state residency.
People who did not receive a stimulus payment need to claim a 'Recovery Rebate Credit' on their federal returns.
The first stimulus payments were up to $1,200 per person and $500 per qualifying child, and the second payments were up to $600 each.
The IRS Get My Payment tool can be used to check the status of your stimulus payment.
